thread.title: Remembering Ed Sullivan on the 41th anniversary of his death
thread.title_full: Remembering Ed Sullivan on the 41th anniversary of his death

title: Remembering Ed Sullivan on the 41th anniversary of his death
text: Blogs Remembering Ed Sullivan on the 41th anniversary of his death Iconic television host Ed Sullivan was a staple of American TV for decades. In honor of the 40th anniversary of his death, take a look back at some of the highlights from his impressive career. Photo: Hy Rothman/New York Daily News./ Published: 10/13/2015 1:39:04 Ed Sullivan Ed Sullivan passed away 41 years ago on Oct. 13, 1974, but his legacy lives on. As the TV host of "The Ed Sullivan Show" from 1948-1971, a variety show on CBS -- Ed was known for his range of acts, and introducing artists such as The Beatles, Jackson 5, The Rolling Stones, The Supremes and the Beach Boys to comedians like Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis. Sullivan, who was also a Daily New columnist, is pictured here receiving the Emmy award for Best Variety Series for his show, then known as "Talk of the Town." 1 of 17
